revised_title: Singularities in Water Waves and Rayleigh-Taylor Instability: Analyzing and Calculating Their Effects
tldr: This paper investigates singularities in water waves and the Rayleigh-Taylor instability, focusing on their formation and location. The author presents results describing the precise form, number, and location of singularities in the unphysical domain as the wave height increases. These findings can be used to calculate water waves numerically in an efficient manner. The study of singularities in these flows helps to understand their ill-posedness and the potential effects of regularization on their time evolution.
